title: Ticket #5489: Linux kernel tuning script doesn't tell anyone (else) what it's doing.
description:
The Linux kernel tuning script logs its actions, but not to anywhere a sysadmin would normally think of looking. We should fix that.

We have two proposals, both of which sound reasonable:

  1. The first is to duplicate the existing logging messages using 'logger -t htcondor' to cause them to appear in Syslog
  2. The second is write a commented-out file in subdirectory /etc/sysctl.d (but only if that directory already exists) that includes much the same information and maybe a little blurb about the script and where to find it (and the HTCondor config knobs).
remarks:
2016-Jan-16 14:09:23 by bbockelm:
What about utilizing real, uncommented settings in /etc/sysctl.d on platforms with support (all Linux distros supported but RHEL6)?

If some settings still can't use sysctl.d (for example, if a value must be computed), then we can do both options (1) and (2).

2016-Mar-22 10:46:29 by tannenba:
If we feel confident about this change, should this be backported to v8.4.x?
